content:
HttpCapabilitiesBase Class

Definition

Provides access to detailed information about the capabilities of the client's browser.

In this Article

public class HttpCapabilitiesBase : System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService
Inheritance
System.Object
HttpCapabilitiesBase

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

HttpCapabilitiesBase is the base class from which the HttpBrowserCapabilities class is derived. HttpCapabilitiesBase offers a large number of read-only properties that provide type-safe access to a browser's capabilities dictionary. You can access the HttpBrowserCapabilities class through the Browser property that is exposed by the ASP.NET Browser property.

Constructors

HttpCapabilitiesBase()

Creates a new instance of the HttpCapabilitiesBase class.

public HttpCapabilitiesBase ();

Properties

ActiveXControls

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports ActiveX controls.

public bool ActiveXControls { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports ActiveX controls; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Adapters

Returns the collection of available control adapters.

public System.Collections.IDictionary Adapters { get; }
Value
IDictionary

The collection of registered control adapters.

AOL

Gets a value indicating whether the client is an America Online (AOL) browser.

public bool AOL { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser is an AOL browser; otherwise, false. The default is false.

BackgroundSounds

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports playing background sounds using the <bgsounds> HTML element.

public bool BackgroundSounds { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports playing background sounds; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Beta

Gets a value indicating whether the browser is a beta version.

public bool Beta { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser is a beta version; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

Beta version browsers can exhibit unpredictable behavior.

Browser

Gets the browser string (if any) that was sent by the browser in the User-Agent request header.

public string Browser { get; }
Value
String

The contents of the User-Agent request header sent by the browser.

BrowserCapabilitiesProvider

Gets or sets the HttpCapabilitiesProvider object for the current browser.

public static System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesProvider BrowserCapabilitiesProvider { get; set; }
Value
HttpCapabilitiesProvider

The HttpCapabilitiesProvider object for the current browser.

Browsers

Gets an ArrayList of the browsers in the stem.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.Capabilities* dictionary.

public System.Collections.ArrayList Browsers { get; }
Value
ArrayList

An ArrayList of the browsers in the stem.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.Capabilities* dictionary.

CanCombineFormsInDeck

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports decks that contain multiple forms, such as separate cards.

public virtual bool CanCombineFormsInDeck { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports decks that contain multiple forms; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The CanCombineFormsInDeck property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices. If true, the adapter can output multiple forms from the same page as cards of a single deck, where possible.

CanInitiateVoiceCall

Gets a value indicating whether the browser device is capable of initiating a voice call.

public virtual bool CanInitiateVoiceCall { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser device is capable of initiating a voice call; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The CanInitiateVoiceCall property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

CanRenderAfterInputOrSelectElement

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports page content following WML <select> or <input> elements.

public virtual bool CanRenderAfterInputOrSelectElement { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports page content following HTML <select>or <input>elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The CanRenderAfterInputOrSelectElement property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

CanRenderEmptySelects

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports empty HTML <select> elements.

public virtual bool CanRenderEmptySelects { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports empty HTML <select> elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

CanRenderInputAndSelectElementsTogether

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports WML INPUT and SELECT elements together on the same card.

public virtual bool CanRenderInputAndSelectElementsTogether { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports WML <input> and <select> elements together; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The CanRenderInputAndSelectElementsTogether property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

CanRenderMixedSelects

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports WML <option> elements that specify both onpick and value attributes.

public virtual bool CanRenderMixedSelects { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports WML <option> elements that specify both onpick and value attributes; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The CanRenderMixedSelects property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

If false, onpick values are displayed as hyperlinks and value attributes require a <do> element for postback.

CanRenderOneventAndPrevElementsTogether

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports WML <onevent> and <prev> elements that coexist within the same WML card.

public virtual bool CanRenderOneventAndPrevElementsTogether { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports WML <onevent> and <prev> elements that coexist within the same WML card; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The CanRenderOneventAndPrevElementsTogether property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

If false, WML <onevent> and <prev> elements that coexist within the same WML card will not be properly rendered.

CanRenderPostBackCards

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports WML cards for postback.

public virtual bool CanRenderPostBackCards { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports WML cards for postback; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The CanRenderPostBackCards property applies only to WML-compatible mobile-device browsers.

If false, postback cards will not be properly rendered by the browser.

CanRenderSetvarZeroWithMultiSelectionList

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports WML <setvar> elements with a value attribute of 0.

public virtual bool CanRenderSetvarZeroWithMultiSelectionList { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports WML <setvar> elements with a value attribute of 0; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The CanRenderSetvarZeroWithMultiSelectionList property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

If false, HTML <setvar> elements with a value attribute of 0 will not display correctly.

CanSendMail

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports sending e-mail by using the HTML <mailto> element for displaying electronic addresses.

public virtual bool CanSendMail { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports sending e-mail by using the HTML <mailto> element for displaying electronic addresses; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Capabilities

Used internally to get the defined capabilities of the browser.

public System.Collections.IDictionary Capabilities { get; set; }
Value
IDictionary

The defined capabilities of the browser.

CDF

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports Channel Definition Format (CDF) for webcasting.

public bool CDF { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports CDF; otherwise, false. The default is false.

ClrVersion

Gets the version of the .NET Framework that is installed on the client.

public Version ClrVersion { get; }
Value
Version

The common language runtime Version.

Remarks

The ClrVersion property is supported only when the browser is Internet Explorer version 5.0 and later.

If the .NET Framework is not installed on the client, the value of the version elements returned is 0, 0,-1,-1.

If more than one version of the .NET Framework is installed on the client, the ClrVersion property returns the latest version.

Cookies

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports cookies.

public bool Cookies { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports cookies; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The Cookies property indicates whether the browser application supports cookies. If the user has disabled cookies in their application, the Cookies property will not be affected.

Crawler

Gets a value indicating whether the browser is a search engine Web crawler.

public bool Crawler { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser is a search engine; otherwise, false. The default is false.

DefaultSubmitButtonLimit

Returns the maximum number of Submit buttons that are allowed for a form.

public virtual int DefaultSubmitButtonLimit { get; }
Value
Int32

The maximum number of Submit buttons that are allowed for a form.

Remarks

The DefaultSubmitButtonLimit property primarily represents the number of soft keys that are available on a WML-compatible mobile device.

Web Forms pages for mobile devices can contain a SelectionList object and more than one Command control. The DefaultSubmitButtonLimit allows you to choose which of the Command controls should be assigned to a soft key on devices that have multiple soft keys.

EcmaScriptVersion

Gets the version number of ECMAScript that the browser supports.

public Version EcmaScriptVersion { get; }
Value
Version

The version number of ECMAScript that the browser supports.

Frames

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports HTML frames.

public bool Frames { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports frames; otherwise, false. The default is false.

GatewayMajorVersion

Gets the major version number of the wireless gateway used to access the server, if known.

public virtual int GatewayMajorVersion { get; }
Value
Int32

The major version number of the wireless gateway used to access the server, if known. The default is 0.

Exceptions
HttpUnhandledException

The major version number of the wireless gateway cannot be parsed.

GatewayMinorVersion

Gets the minor version number of the wireless gateway used to access the server, if known.

public virtual double GatewayMinorVersion { get; }
Value
Double

The minor version number of the wireless gateway used to access the server, if known. The default is 0.

Exceptions
HttpUnhandledException

The minor version number of the wireless gateway cannot be parsed.

GatewayVersion

Gets the version of the wireless gateway used to access the server, if known.

public virtual string GatewayVersion { get; }
Value
String

The version number of the wireless gateway used to access the server, if known. The default is None.

HasBackButton

Gets a value indicating whether the browser has a dedicated Back button.

public virtual bool HasBackButton { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser has a dedicated Back button; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

If false, a link control might be necessary when a Back button is not available.

HidesRightAlignedMultiselectScrollbars

Gets a value indicating whether the scrollbar of an HTML <select multiple> element with an align attribute value of right is obscured upon rendering.

public virtual bool HidesRightAlignedMultiselectScrollbars { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the scrollbar of an HTML <select multiple> element with an align attribute value of right is obscured upon rendering; otherwise, false. The default is false.

HtmlTextWriter

Gets or sets the fully qualified class name of the HtmlTextWriter to use.

public string HtmlTextWriter { get; set; }
Value
String

The fully qualified class name of the HtmlTextWriter to use.

Id

Gets the internal identifier of the browser as specified in the browser definition file.

public string Id { get; }
Value
String

Internal identifier of the browser as specified in the browser definition file.

InputType

Returns the type of input supported by browser.

public virtual string InputType { get; }
Value
String

The type of input supported by browser. The default is telephoneKeypad.

Remarks

Possible return values include:

  • virtualKeyboard

  • telephoneKeypad

  • keyboard

IsColor

Gets a value indicating whether the browser has a color display.

public virtual bool IsColor { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser has a color display; otherwise, false. The default is false.

IsMobileDevice

Gets a value indicating whether the browser is a recognized mobile device.

public virtual bool IsMobileDevice { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser is a recognized mobile device; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Item(String)

Gets the value of the specified browser capability. In C#, this property is the indexer for the class.

public virtual string this[string key] { get; }
key
String

The name of the browser capability to retrieve.

Value
String

The browser capability with the specified key name.

Remarks

In JScript, you can use the default indexed properties defined by a type, but you cannot explicitly define your own. However, specifying the expando attribute on a class automatically provides a default indexed property with a type of Object and an index type of String.

JavaApplets

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports Java.

public bool JavaApplets { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports Java; otherwise, false. The default is false.

JavaScript

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports JavaScript.

public bool JavaScript { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports JavaScript; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If the browser supports JavaScript but scripting is disabled through a security setting, the JavaScript property will return true but script will not execute on the browser.

JScriptVersion

Gets the JScript version that the browser supports.

public Version JScriptVersion { get; }
Value
Version

The Version of JScript that the browser supports.

MajorVersion

Gets the major (integer) version number of the browser.

public int MajorVersion { get; }
Value
Int32

The major version number of the browser.

Exceptions
Exception

The major version value is not an integer.

MaximumHrefLength

Gets the maximum length in characters for the href attribute of an HTML <a> (anchor) element.

public virtual int MaximumHrefLength { get; }
Value
Int32

The maximum length in characters for the href attribute of an HTML <a> (anchor) element.

MaximumRenderedPageSize

Gets the maximum length of the page, in bytes, which the browser can display.

public virtual int MaximumRenderedPageSize { get; }
Value
Int32

The maximum length of the page, in bytes, which the browser can display. The default is 2000.

Remarks

Processing by an intermediate gateway can change the number of bytes that reach the browser. ASP.NET does not enforce this limit on page size.

MaximumRenderedPageSize is primarily useful when working with mobile-client browsers.

MaximumSoftkeyLabelLength

Returns the maximum length of the text that a soft-key label can display.

public virtual int MaximumSoftkeyLabelLength { get; }
Value
Int32

The maximum length of the text that a soft-key label can display. The default is 5.

Remarks

The MaximumSoftkeyLabelLength property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

MinorVersion

Gets the minor (that is, decimal) version number of the browser.

public double MinorVersion { get; }
Value
Double

The minor version number of the browser.

Exceptions
HttpUnhandledException

The minor version number in the header is not valid.

MinorVersionString

Gets the minor (decimal) version number of the browser as a string.

public string MinorVersionString { get; }
Value
String

The minor version number of the browser.

MobileDeviceManufacturer

Returns the name of the manufacturer of a mobile device, if known.

public virtual string MobileDeviceManufacturer { get; }
Value
String

The name of the manufacturer of a mobile device, if known. The default is Unknown.

MobileDeviceModel

Gets the model name of a mobile device, if known.

public virtual string MobileDeviceModel { get; }
Value
String

The model name of a mobile device, if known. The default is Unknown.

MSDomVersion

Gets the version of Microsoft HTML (MSHTML) Document Object Model (DOM) that the browser supports.

public Version MSDomVersion { get; }
Value
Version

The number of the MSHTML DOM version that the browser supports.

NumberOfSoftkeys

Returns the number of soft keys on a mobile device.

public virtual int NumberOfSoftkeys { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of soft keys supported on a mobile device. The default is 0.

Remarks

The NumberOfSoftkeys property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

Soft keys are special keys that the application can usually map to custom tasks. Soft-key text is displayed on the screen in the lower-left and lower-right corners.

Platform

Gets the name of the platform that the client uses, if it is known.

public string Platform { get; }
Value
String

The operating system that the client uses, if it is known, otherwise the value is set to Unknown.

Remarks

Some of the possible values for the Platform property are as follows:

  • Unknown

  • Win95

  • Win98

  • Windows NT 5.0 (Windows 2000)

  • Windows NT 5.1 (Windows XP)

  • WinNT (all other versions of Windows NT)

  • Win16

  • WinCE

  • Mac68K

  • MacPPC

  • UNIX

  • WebTV

PreferredImageMime

Returns the MIME type of the type of image content typically preferred by the browser.

public virtual string PreferredImageMime { get; }
Value
String

The MIME type of the type of image content typically preferred by the browser. The default is image/gif.

PreferredRenderingMime

Returns the MIME type of the type of content typically preferred by the browser.

public virtual string PreferredRenderingMime { get; }
Value
String

The MIME type of the type of content typically preferred by the browser. The default is text/html.

PreferredRenderingType

Gets the general name for the type of content that the browser prefers.

public virtual string PreferredRenderingType { get; }
Value
String

html32 or chtml10. The default is html32.

PreferredRequestEncoding

Gets the request encoding preferred by the browser.

public virtual string PreferredRequestEncoding { get; }
Value
String

The request encoding preferred by the browser.

PreferredResponseEncoding

Gets the response encoding preferred by the browser.

public virtual string PreferredResponseEncoding { get; }
Value
String

The response encoding preferred by the browser.

RendersBreakBeforeWmlSelectAndInput

Gets a value indicating whether the browser renders a line break before <select> or <input> elements.

public virtual bool RendersBreakBeforeWmlSelectAndInput { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser renders a line break before <select> or <input> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The RendersBreakBeforeWmlSelectAndInput property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

If true, content following <select> or <input> elements will automatically be placed on a new line.

RendersBreaksAfterHtmlLists

Gets a value indicating whether the browser renders a line break after list-item elements.

public virtual bool RendersBreaksAfterHtmlLists { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser renders a line break after list-item elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

If true, content following list-item elements will automatically be placed on a new line.

RendersBreaksAfterWmlAnchor

Gets a value indicating whether the browser renders a line break after a stand-alone HTML <a> (anchor) element.

public virtual bool RendersBreaksAfterWmlAnchor { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser renders a line break after a stand-alone HTML <a> (anchor) element; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The RendersBreaksAfterWmlAnchor property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

If true, content following a stand-alone HTML <a> (anchor) element will automatically be placed on a new line.

RendersBreaksAfterWmlInput

Gets a value indicating whether the browser renders a line break after an HTML <input> element.

public virtual bool RendersBreaksAfterWmlInput { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser renders a line break after an HTML <input>element; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The RendersBreaksAfterWmlInput property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

If true, content following an HTML <input> element will automatically be placed on a new line.

RendersWmlDoAcceptsInline

Gets a value indicating whether the mobile-device browser renders a WML do-based form accept construct as an inline button rather than as a soft key.

public virtual bool RendersWmlDoAcceptsInline { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the mobile-device browser renders a WML do-based form-accept construct as an inline button; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The RendersWmlDoAcceptsInline property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

RendersWmlSelectsAsMenuCards

Gets a value indicating whether the browser renders WML <select> elements as menu cards, rather than as a combo box.

public virtual bool RendersWmlSelectsAsMenuCards { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser renders WML <select> elements as menu cards; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The RendersWmlSelectsAsMenuCards property applies only to WML-compatible mobile devices.

RequiredMetaTagNameValue

Used internally to produce a meta-tag required by some browsers.

public virtual string RequiredMetaTagNameValue { get; }
Value
String

A meta-tag required by some browsers.

Remarks

Intended for internal use only. Some browsers require a meta-tag similar to the following for the browser to render properly. 

<META NAME="NAME" CONTENT="VALUE">

RequiresAttributeColonSubstitution

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires colons in element attribute values to be substituted with a different character.

public virtual bool RequiresAttributeColonSubstitution { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires colons in element attribute values to be substituted with a different character; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

Some browsers do not recognize colons in element attribute values. If true, a different character will be substituted on rendering and returned in postback data.

RequiresContentTypeMetaTag

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires an HTML <meta> element for which the content-type attribute is specified.

public virtual bool RequiresContentTypeMetaTag { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires an HTML <meta> element for which the content-type attribute is specified; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If true, server-control adapters insert the following tag into the HTML <head> element of a Web page: 

<META HTTP-EQUIV="CONTENT-TYPE" CONTENT=""; CHARSET="">

In this example, CONTENT is the value returned by the PreferredRenderingMime property, and charset is the character encoding used.

RequiresControlStateInSession

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires control state to be maintained in sessions.

public bool RequiresControlStateInSession { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires control state to be maintained in sessions; otherwise, false. The default is false.

RequiresDBCSCharacter

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires a double-byte character set.

public virtual bool RequiresDBCSCharacter { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires a double-byte character set; otherwise, false. The default is false.

RequiresHtmlAdaptiveErrorReporting

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires nonstandard error messages.

public virtual bool RequiresHtmlAdaptiveErrorReporting { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires nonstandard error messages; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If true, the browser does not properly render HTTP error messages. To correct this, server control adapters generate a custom error page for the browser.

RequiresLeadingPageBreak

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires the first element in the body of a Web page to be an HTML <br> element.

public virtual bool RequiresLeadingPageBreak { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires the first element in the body of a Web page to be an HTML BR element; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If true, server-control adapters insert an additional <br> element immediately following the <body> tag in a Web page.

RequiresNoBreakInFormatting

Gets a value indicating whether the browser does not support HTML <br> elements to format line breaks.

public virtual bool RequiresNoBreakInFormatting { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser does not support HTML <br> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If true, the browser will not correctly render pages containing the HTML <br> element.

RequiresOutputOptimization

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires pages to contain a size-optimized form of markup language tags.

public virtual bool RequiresOutputOptimization { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires pages to contain a size-optimized form of markup language tags; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

If true, server control adapters generate minimal output to reduce the size of the resulting page.

Note

The RequiresOutputOptimization property returns true for i-modecompatible browsers.

RequiresPhoneNumbersAsPlainText

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports phone dialing based on plain text, or whether it requires special markup.

public virtual bool RequiresPhoneNumbersAsPlainText { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports phone dialing based on plain text only; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The RequiresPhoneNumbersAsPlainText property applies only to browsers for which the CanInitiateVoiceCall property is true.

RequiresSpecialViewStateEncoding

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires VIEWSTATE values to be specially encoded.

public virtual bool RequiresSpecialViewStateEncoding { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires VIEWSTATE values to be specially encoded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

HTTP is a stateless protocol, and VIEWSTATE is one mechanism used to persist client changes across multiple requests. Each control on a Web page contains a ViewState property, which represents the accumulation of any changes made by the client. In a Web Forms page, these changes are encoded in postback data as the value of an HTML <input> element with a type attribute of hidden. For example: 

<input type="hidden" name="__VIEWSTATE" value="t0PH_u56?cDxleHQ7P=" />

If true, non-alphabetic characters in the VIEWSTATE value will not be sent correctly by the browser, nor by an intermediate gateway. To correct this, server-control adapters replace non-alphabetic characters in the VIEWSTATE value with ones that do not require encoding in HTTP requests.

RequiresUniqueFilePathSuffix

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires unique form-action URLs.

public virtual bool RequiresUniqueFilePathSuffix { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires unique form-action URLs; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

A self-referring HTML <form> element is one for which the action attribute specifies its own URL. If true, self-referring forms do not return the correct results. This is due to caching by either the browser or an intermediate gateway. To correct this, server control adapters append a default query string (__ufps=``uniquefilepathsuffix) onto the form-action URL values of self-referring forms.

RequiresUniqueHtmlCheckboxNames

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires unique name attribute values of multiple HTML <input type="checkbox"> elements.

public virtual bool RequiresUniqueHtmlCheckboxNames { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires unique name attribute values of multiple HTML <input type="checkbox"> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

RequiresUniqueHtmlInputNames

Gets a value indicating whether the browser requires unique name attribute values of multiple HTML <input> elements.

public virtual bool RequiresUniqueHtmlInputNames { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser requires unique name attribute values of multiple HTML <input> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

RequiresUrlEncodedPostfieldValues

Gets a value indicating whether postback data sent by the browser will be UrlEncoded.

public virtual bool RequiresUrlEncodedPostfieldValues { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if postback data sent by the browser will be UrlEncoded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

ScreenBitDepth

Returns the depth of the display, in bits per pixel.

public virtual int ScreenBitDepth { get; }
Value
Int32

The depth of the display, in bits per pixel. The default is 1.

ScreenCharactersHeight

Returns the approximate height of the display, in character lines.

public virtual int ScreenCharactersHeight { get; }
Value
Int32

The approximate height of the display, in character lines. The default is 6.

Remarks

The returned value can be derived from the assumed character size and actual screen pixel size. The algorithm for determining the height uses a combination of the default font sizes (from a .config file), browser-specific sizes (again, from a .config file), and explicit headers sent by the browser. Some browsers might rely on internal default values, which only approximate the actual height.

ScreenCharactersWidth

Returns the approximate width of the display, in characters.

public virtual int ScreenCharactersWidth { get; }
Value
Int32

The approximate width of the display, in characters. The default is 12.

Remarks

The returned value can be derived from the assumed character size and actual screen pixel size. The algorithm for determining the width uses a combination of the default font sizes (from a .config file), device-specific sizes (again, from a .config file), and explicit headers sent by the devices. These values are not necessarily exact (especially for variable-width fonts, these values are approximate). Some devices might rely on internal default values, which only approximate the actual width.

ScreenPixelsHeight

Returns the approximate height of the display, in pixels.

public virtual int ScreenPixelsHeight { get; }
Value
Int32

The approximate height of the display, in pixels. The default is 72.

Remarks

The returned value can be derived from the assumed character size and character height. The algorithm for determining the pixel height uses a combination of the default font sizes (from a .config file), device-specific sizes (again, from a .config file), and explicit headers sent by the devices. These values are not necessarily exact. Some devices might rely on internal default values, which only approximate the actual height.

ScreenPixelsWidth

Returns the approximate width of the display, in pixels.

public virtual int ScreenPixelsWidth { get; }
Value
Int32

The approximate width of the display, in pixels. The default is 96.

Remarks

The returned value can be derived from the assumed character size and character width. The algorithm for determining the pixel width uses a combination of the default font sizes (from a .config file), device-specific sizes (again, from a .config file), and explicit headers sent by the devices. These values are not necessarily exact (especially for variable-width fonts, these values are approximate). Some devices might rely on internal default values, which only approximate the actual width.

SupportsAccesskeyAttribute

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the ACCESSKEY attribute of HTML <a> (anchor) and <input> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsAccesskeyAttribute { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the accesskey attribute of HTML <a> (anchor) and <input> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The accesskey attribute extends control of forms and links on a Web page to mobile and accessible platforms by assigning a soft key or other controller on the device to interact with HTML <a> (anchor) and <input> elements.

SupportsBodyColor

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the bgcolor attribute of the HTML <body> element.

public virtual bool SupportsBodyColor { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the bgcolor attribute of the HTML <body> element; otherwise, false. The default is true.

SupportsBold

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports HTML <b> elements to format bold text.

public virtual bool SupportsBold { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports HTML <b> elements to format bold text; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsCacheControlMetaTag

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the cache-control value for the http-equiv attribute of HTML <meta> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsCacheControlMetaTag { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the cache-control value for the http-equiv attribute of HTML <meta> elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

The cache-control value for the http-equiv attribute of HTML <meta> elements allows control over client caching of downloaded content, which includes Web pages. The following HTML fragment shows an example: 

<META HTTP-EQUIV="CACHE-CONTROL" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"/>

If true, the inclusion of this tag in the <head> element of a Web page should force the browser to reload content from the server.

If false, server control adapters append a default query string (__ufps=``uniquefilepathsuffix) onto link URL values that do not already have one. This forces the browser to reload content from the server.

The SupportsCacheControlMetaTag property also applies to the equivalent HTTP header form: 

CACHE-CONTROL: NO-CACHE

SupportsCallback

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports callback scripts.

public virtual bool SupportsCallback { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports callback scripts; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsCss

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports Cascading Style Sheets (CSS).

public virtual bool SupportsCss { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports CSS; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsDivAlign

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the align attribute of HTML <div> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsDivAlign { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the align attribute of HTML <div> elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

HTML <div> elements are used to group multiple HTML elements so that CSS styles can be applied to them as a whole. The align attribute sets the horizontal alignment of a <div> group on a Web page.

SupportsDivNoWrap

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the nowrap attribute of HTML <div> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsDivNoWrap { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the nowrap attribute of HTML <div> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

HTML <div> elements are used to group multiple HTML elements so that CSS styles can be applied to them as a whole. The nowrap attribute specifies that the elements contained in the <div> group should remain adjacent to each other without wrapping to a new line.

SupportsEmptyStringInCookieValue

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports empty (null) strings in cookie values.

public virtual bool SupportsEmptyStringInCookieValue { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports empty (null) strings in cookie values; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsFontColor

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the color attribute of HTML <font> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsFontColor { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the color attribute of HTML <font>elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

SupportsFontName

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the name attribute of HTML <font> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsFontName { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the name attribute of HTML <font> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsFontSize

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the size attribute of HTML <font>elements.

public virtual bool SupportsFontSize { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the size attribute of HTML <font> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsImageSubmit

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports using a custom image in place of a standard form Submit button.

public virtual bool SupportsImageSubmit { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports using a custom image in place of a standard form Submit button; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsIModeSymbols

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports i-mode symbols.

public virtual bool SupportsIModeSymbols { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports i-mode symbols; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The SupportsInputMode property applies only to i-modecompatible devices.

Set i-Phonespecific picture symbols for i-modecompatible browsers by using the ImageUrlproperty.

SupportsInputIStyle

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the istyle attribute of HTML <input> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsInputIStyle { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the istyle attribute of HTML <input> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The SupportsInputMode property applies only to i-modecompatible devices.

The istyle attribute is used for setting the input style of a text-input field on i-modecompatible browsers.

SupportsInputMode

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the mode attribute of HTML <input> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsInputMode { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the mode attribute of HTML <input> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The SupportsInputMode property applies only to i-modecompatible devices.

The MODE attribute is used for setting the input mode of a text input field on i-modecompatible browsers.

SupportsItalic

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports HTML <i> elements to format italic text.

public virtual bool SupportsItalic { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports HTML <i> elements to format italic text; otherwise, false. The default is false.

SupportsJPhoneMultiMediaAttributes

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports J-Phone multimedia attributes.

public virtual bool SupportsJPhoneMultiMediaAttributes { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports J-Phone multimedia attributes; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The SupportsJPhoneMultiMediaAttributes property applies only to J-Phonecompatible mobile devices.

J-Phone is a markup language specification, based on HTML, for J-Phonecompatible browsers. If true, the browser supports additional attributes for HTML <a> (anchor) and <select> elements. The additional attributes supported are as follows:

  • src

  • soundstart

  • loop

  • volume

  • vibration

  • viblength

SupportsJPhoneSymbols

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports J-Phonespecific picture symbols.

public virtual bool SupportsJPhoneSymbols { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports J-Phonespecific picture symbols; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The SupportsJPhoneSymbols property applies only to J-Phonecompatible mobile devices.

Set J-Phonespecific picture symbols for J-Phonecompatible browsers by using the ImageUrl property.

SupportsQueryStringInFormAction

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports a query string in the action attribute value of HTML <form> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsQueryStringInFormAction { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports a query string in the action attribute value of HTML <form> elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

If false, query string parameters are sent, in postback data, as HTML <input> elements with the type attributes set to hidden.

SupportsRedirectWithCookie

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports cookies on redirection.

public virtual bool SupportsRedirectWithCookie { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports cookies on redirection; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

With UP.Browser 4.1 or UP.Browser 3.2, the Redirect method behaves as if the value of the SupportsRedirectWithCookie property of the HttpBrowserCapabilities object is false, unless the Cookieless property in the SessionState section of Web.config has been explicitly set to true.

In ASP.NET 1.1, the options for this setting were true or false, but with ASP.NET 2.0, the choices are expanded, and HttpCookieMode is now the default setting. If your Web application has the cookieless attribute of the <sessionState> section in the Web.config file set to a Boolean value, Redirect should work as expected for these browsers.

SupportsSelectMultiple

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports the multiple attribute of HTML <select> elements.

public virtual bool SupportsSelectMultiple { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports the multiple attribute of HTML <select> elements; otherwise, false. The default is true.

SupportsUncheck

Gets a value indicating whether the clearing of a checked HTML <input type=checkbox> element is reflected in postback data.

public virtual bool SupportsUncheck { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the clearing of a checked HTML <input type=checkbox> element is reflected in postback data; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

If false, the value of the checked attribute of HTML <input type=checkbox> elements is omitted from postback data.

SupportsXmlHttp

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports receiving XML over HTTP.

public virtual bool SupportsXmlHttp { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports receiving XML over HTTP; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Tables

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports HTML <table> elements.

public bool Tables { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports HTML <table> elements; otherwise, false. The default is false.

TagWriter

Used internally to get the type of the object that is used to write tags for the browser.

public Type TagWriter { get; }
Value
Type

The Type of the object that is used to write tags for the browser.

Exceptions
HttpUnhandledException

There is a parse error.

Type

Gets the name and major (integer) version number of the browser.

public string Type { get; }
Value
String

The name and major version number of the browser.

UseOptimizedCacheKey

Used internally to get a value indicating whether to use an optimized cache key.

public bool UseOptimizedCacheKey { get; }
Value
Boolean

true to use an optimized cache key; otherwise, false. The default is false.

VBScript

Gets a value indicating whether the browser supports Visual Basic Scripting edition (VBScript).

public bool VBScript { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser supports VBScript; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Version

Gets the full version number (integer and decimal) of the browser as a string.

public string Version { get; }
Value
String

The full version number of the browser as a string.

Remarks

The Version property returns a string. In some scenarios, the Version property might contain letter characters, as in the case of a browser or client device that is a beta version such as "7.0b." To correctly get the version as a data type that can be used in a numeric comparison, concatenate the MajorVersion and MinorVersion property values.

W3CDomVersion

Gets the version of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) XML Document Object Model (DOM) that the browser supports.

public Version W3CDomVersion { get; }
Value
Version

The number of the W3C XML DOM version number that the browser supports.

Win16

Gets a value indicating whether the client is a Win16-based computer.

public bool Win16 { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the browser is running on a Win16-based computer; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Win32

Gets a value indicating whether the client is a Win32-based computer.

public bool Win32 { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the client is a Win32-based computer; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Methods

AddBrowser(String)

Used internally to add an entry to the internal collection of browsers for which capabilities are recognized.

public void AddBrowser (string browserName);
browserName
String

The name of the browser to add.

CreateHtmlTextWriter(TextWriter)

Creates a new instance of the HtmlTextWriter to be used.

public System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter CreateHtmlTextWriter (System.IO.TextWriter w);
w
TextWriter

TextWriter to be created.

Returns
HtmlTextWriter

A new instance of the HtmlTextWriter to be used.

Exceptions
Exception

The method failed to create an instance of HtmlTextWriter.

DisableOptimizedCacheKey()

Used internally to disable use of an optimized cache key.

public void DisableOptimizedCacheKey ();

GetClrVersions()

Returns all versions of the .NET Framework common language runtime that are installed on the client.

public Version[] GetClrVersions ();
Returns
Version[]

An array of Version objects.

Remarks

The GetClrVersions method is supported only when the browser is Internet Explorer version 5.0 or later. If the common language runtime is not installed on the client, the property returns an array containing a single Version object with the values 0, 0,-1,-1.

GetConfigCapabilities(String,HttpRequest)

Used internally to return an instance of HttpCapabilitiesBase representing the browser that generated the specified HttpRequest.

public static System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase GetConfigCapabilities (string configKey, System.Web.HttpRequest request);
configKey
String

The name of the configuration section that configures browser capabilities.

request
HttpRequest

The HttpRequest generated by the browser for which to return capabilities and which is usually the current HttpRequest.

Returns
HttpCapabilitiesBase

An instance of HttpCapabilitiesBase representing the browser that generated the specified HttpRequest.

Init()

Used internally to initialize an internal set of values.

protected virtual void Init ();

IsBrowser(String)

Gets a value indicating whether the client browser is the same as the specified browser.

public bool IsBrowser (string browserName);
browserName
String

The specified browser.

Returns
Boolean

true if the client browser is the same as the specified browser; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Remarks

The IsBrowser method also returns true if the client browser definition inherits from the specified browser.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IFilterResolutionService.CompareFilters(String,String)

Used internally to compare filters.

int IFilterResolutionService.CompareFilters (string filter1, string filter2);
filter1
String

The first filter to compare.

filter2
String

The second filter to compare.

Returns
Int32

1 if filter1 is a parent of filter2; -1 if filter2 is a parent of filter1; 0 if there is no parent-child relationship between filter1 and filter2.

IFilterResolutionService.EvaluateFilter(String)

Used internally to evaluate a filter.

bool IFilterResolutionService.EvaluateFilter (string filterName);
filterName
String

The filter to evaluate.

Returns
Boolean

true if the filter was successfully evaluated; otherwise, false.

rawMetadata.title: HttpCapabilitiesBase class | Microsoft Docs
rawMetadata.description: Provides access to detailed information about the capabilities of the client's browser.
